help_question_1_description: Calculates the hash (checksum) of the file and sends it to the blockchain transaction
help_question_2_title: What is the hash of the file?
help_question_2_description: This is a unique "serial number" or "fingerprint" of your data. Changing, at least one bit in the original file, you will get a completely different hash sum. Thus, having the hash sum in a safe place, you can always check the integrity of your data by matching it with your hash sum
help_question_3_description: 1. Checking the integrity of data using the hash-sum that is permanently stored on the blockchain.2.  The timestamp - you can definitely check when was the publication of the transaction on the blockchain. 2. The authorship, because the transaction is associated with the person who paid
help_question_4_description: Add a file you want to verify on the site. If the file is in the blockchain, you will see Name Value Service (NVS) entry. In the Name field there is a hash sum, in the Value field is user's data. If the user did not specify anything in Value, by default there will be a hash sum of the payer's email address
help_question_5_description: The authorship is proved by the connection between the payer and the blockchain entry. In fact, the service links the payment through PayPal email to the transaction. By default, the hash sum of the email address is published. But users can open email, and they can add other data to the Value field when they notarize the file. For example, name, phone, URL link.
help_question_6_title: Is the file stored on the blockchain?
help_question_6_description: No, take care of keeping your files securely. The service does not store files. Only hashes. You cannot restore the file from it.
help_question_7_description: "No one, not even us. The hash sum is calculated locally on your PC, and the file never leaves your disk. So, to whom to transfer your file or from whom to save it, you take care of yourself."
help_question_8_title: Is it possible to determine by the hash sum what the file contains?
help_question_9_title: Is it possible to notarize the same file twice?
help_question_9_description: Yes, the index number is added to the hash sum through the colon. When you search, you see all transactions for notarizing this file, starting from the first.
help_question_10_title: And how is the authorship protected then, if anyone can notarize the file any number of times?
help_question_10_description: Timestamp. This corresponds to the legal principle of proof of authorship. The one who can prove that he owned it first, he is the author. So, before submitting your materials to anyone or their publication, first make a notarization on our service.
help_question_11_title: How else can legally copyright be protected?
home_motivating_text: Blockchain notarization online - certification of electronic data without a notary
home_wait_description: 10-15 min for a confirmation of blockchain transaction
home_answer_description: Certificate of notarization on your email
home_network_error: Sorry, the server is currently unavailable.
verify_modal_info_title: What for hashing mail? What for write additional information?
verify_modal_info_text: Our robot loves cryptography. It takes your document and turns it into a single 32-digit string of letters and numbers.
